prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions:** **Part 1: Base Prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the base prism. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position and orient the prism properly. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following faces, loops, and curves: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.0] - Line 5: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.625] - Line 7: Start Point [0.75, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.625] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Once the 2D sketch is completed, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrusion depths towards the normal and opposite normal to 0.5 and 0.0, respectively. Use a sketch scale of 0.75 for this operation. This prism will serve as the base for subsequent parts. **Part 2: Top Tapering Prism** Create a new coordinate system for the tapering prism on top of the base prism. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.1256, 0.625]. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, creating the following shapes: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the defined coordinate system. Perform a boolean operation with the base prism by setting the "operation" to "CutFeatureOperation". This will create a tapering prism shape on the top portion of the base prism. Set the extrusion depths towards the normal and opposite normal to 0.0 and 0.125, respectively. Use a sketch scale of 0.75 for this operation. With these step-by-step instructions, the final CAD model will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, with the top being wider than the bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the top</description>
